channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell refuses to answer House committee's questions, appeals for clemency
item.description: In a closed-door deposition with lawmakers, Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded the Fifth. Her attorney later said she would testify in exchange for clemency.
item.content:encoded: In a closed-door deposition with lawmakers, Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell pleaded the Fifth. Her attorney later said she would testify in exchange for clemency.

item.title: Rep. Suhas Subramanyam, D-Va., talks about viewing the unredacted Epstein files
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks to Democratic Rep. Suhas Subramanyam of Virginia about viewing the unredacted Epstein files that the Justice Department made available to members of Congress.

item.title: Britain's PM faces calls to resign over former ambassador's ties to Epstein
item.description: Britain's prime minister is facing calls to resign for naming a friend of Jeffrey Epstein as ambassador to the U.S. Police are also investigating if the king's brother passed trade secrets to Epstein.
item.content:encoded: Britain's prime minister is facing calls to resign for naming a friend of Jeffrey Epstein as ambassador to the U.S. Police are also investigating if the king's brother passed trade secrets to Epstein.

item.title: 'Please inform your friends': The quest to make weather warnings universal
item.description: People in poor countries often get little or no warning about floods, storms and other deadly weather. Local efforts are changing that, and saving lives.

item.title: 'E-bike for your feet': How bionic sneakers could change human mobility
item.description: Nike's battery-powered footwear system, which propels wearers forward, is part of a broader push to help humans move farther and faster.

item.title: Cuban fuel shortage: U.S. blockade of oil grounds flights in Cuba
item.description: Cuba's fuel shortage hits during peak tourist season, grounding flights as the Trump administration's pressure tightens the island's oil supplies.

item.title: Trump takes aim at Colorado, a state that didn't vote for him
item.description: Colorado's Democratic leaders say President Trump is on a political retribution campaign against their state and the fallout will be rural communities on everything from water to planning for disasters.

item.title: Students' push for change results in new Latino history exhibit in Chicago
item.description: Curators and museum leadership typically form and select exhibits. It was high school students though that helped change an exhibit about Latino culture in Chicago. Aqui en Chicago is now open.
